Palin has started campaigning by telling a lie about the Obama campaign. From the Associated Press:
 
 http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/washington/AP-CVN-Palin.html
 
 "Palin swings at Obama
 
 "MINNEAPOLIS (AP) -- Republican vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin on Thursday took an immediate swipe at Democratic nominee Barack Obama in her first solo campaign appearance since joining the GOP ticket. The Alaska governor also issued a fund-raising appeal that blamed the Democratic presidential ticket for spreading ''misinformation and flat-out lies'' about her family and her.
 
 "While the Obama campaign has raised questions about Palin's qualifications, Obama himself has said that her family should be off-limits...."
 
 Obviously, Sarah Palin sees nothing wrong with making false accusations so long as they serve her political aims. 
 
 Is this the kind of person we want for Vice President?

And it's entirely appropriate to question a candidate and to challenge what a candidate says when it's untrue. Sarah Palin is going to be challenged on what she says, like all the other candidates.
Quite so. Candidates should be questioned. But when the questioners presume guilt as in the state trooper case, without presenting all of the facts concerning the case, it becomes mean-spirited and totally unfair. (Then, who said liberals ever should be expected to fight fairly?)
 
 I understand that the trooper used a taser on his own stepson. I understand that the trooper made threats to end the life of Palin's father. I understand that he killed a moose illegally on a permit obtained by someone else. The man has no place in police work.
 
 Have you verified any accusations against Palin? Can you imagine that her family's fear of this rogue cop might be justified. Can you imagine that though she might have wanted and expressed a desire to have him fired for legitimate reasons, she may not have abused her powers as governor? Can you imagine that expressing her opinion as to whether he should lose his badge and gun can be just that...an opinion?
 
 Can you imagine that the disgruntled former employee that released the contents of the two emails to the Washington Post was just that...a disgruntled former employee?
 
 I suspect you are so bent on degrading Sarah Palin that you have ignored or you are totally ignorant of the truth of the matter. But don't worry...the liberal press will continue to fight your cause.

Why does Op ignore all of the accomplishments if she is so objective and sincerely seeking to do what's best for America and not just supporting the candidate that she believes will support her personal social issues?

 
 Instead of attacking me in the third person, why you don't address me directly? That would be the adult thing to do. Instead of attributing motives to me that you imagine, why don't you ask me what I think?
 
 I do not claim to be "objective" in a debate over politics. That's what debates over politics are for, to argue our viewpoints. I support Obama, for reasons I have previously stated. I am not "pretending" anything. I am not neutral, about the Presidential race. I do not support McCain for President, because I disagree with him on most issues, and I think he is impulsive and would make a bad leader. I think he would enact policies that will be bad for our nation. I think, based on what I have read about her so far, that Sarah Palin is unfit to lead the nation and could not step into the Presidency effectively if she were needed.
 
 Those are my views. They are subjective, as are yours. 
 
 I also think the claims that the media have been unfair to Palin are nonsense, and so far no one has produced any evidence of the media being unfair to her.

I do not claim to be "objective" in a debate over politics. That's what debates over politics are for, to argue our viewpoints.

 
 True, but surely you can agree that the more lack of objectivity, the more danger there is of a lack of credibility.
 
 I think there's a difference between the issue of objectivity (or lack thereof) and being for a candidate. I think one can be for a candidate and still be objective, and objectivity doesn't latch hold of negative stories, like they are gospel, about the candidate we aren't for. That's my opinion anyway. :) 
 
 It's a stretch--no, an inaccuracy--to say that any of the current candidates are "unfit" to lead the country. That's the sort of thing said when someone is a criminal, or a drunk, or some other major thing that would prevent them from doing the job. It's the sort of language the military uses to describe an officer who has exibited conduct unbecoming of an officer. Palin is not unfit. There's nothing we know of that would make any of them incapable of leading. You're balking at the idea that she's being treated unfairly, but frankly, you're taking an unfair approach here. You've even raised the specter of "extremist idealogue" in association with her! 
 
 I think the real problem is that you simply don't like they way they are on the issues. Nothing wrong with that, of course. But that doesn't make them unfit to lead.
 
 
I also think the claims that the media have been unfair to Palin are nonsense, and so far no one has produced any evidence of the media being unfair to her.

 
 That's a flat-out falsehood. Steeeeve gave you specific links to examples, and I gave you a link to an article that listed several examples. You keep moving the goalposts and making excuses. When someone points things out, you then shift to arguing people should be "asking questions" as if anyone is even saying we shouldn't ask questions! No one is even arguing we shouldn't.

I have said nothing at all about the state trooper investigation, other than that we should learn the truth about it. You write as though I am the one investigating it.
No. I'm writing as if anyone who reads the facts (and watches the video of the trooper verifying that he did taser the kid and he did illegally shoot the moose and he did threaten Palin's family with bodily harm) should immediately understand that the trooper indeed should be fired and not allowed to carry a gun and badge. He is a rogue cop, a drug-store cowboy, a beligerant adolescent...unworthy of being a state trooper...in any state. 
 

 I have no interest in "degrading" Sarah Palin. I am sure she is a person with many fine qualities. However, when she tells untruths about Obama and tries to smear him in a speech, then we need to stand up for the truth about the candidate she is attacking. 
What untruth has she told...that he lacks experience?
 
 

 She is the one who likened herself to a pit bull. She is the one who went on the attack against Obama, not the other way around.
Likening one's self to an animal is generally done to draw a comparison of similar traits.
 
 "Blind as a bat" is generally NOT used to call someone a bat but is used to say that the person cannot see well. All other bat-like traits are unsuggested. Her comment about pit bulls and hockey moms was not meant to equate the two groups...just to suggest fearlessness and toughness.
 
 She attacked Obama because he needs to be exposed. He is not experienced in making executive decisions. Being a "Community Organizer" is NOTHING compared to actually leading an organization. All it takes to be a community organizer is the ability to rev people up with speeches and pats on the back.
 
 Just look at how many times Obama voted "Present" in the Illinois government. He is a do-nothing, talk-smoothly, polished politician with absolutely no viable plan for the future of this country. His desire appears to be to place his family and friends among the ruling elite of a socialist society. His methodology appears to be that of promising redistribution of wealth to those voters who can be duped into thinking they will be better off under the umbrella of socialism...and that those filthy old rich people will be punished...along with those evil companies that control the work force. He appears to be willing to kill this country. His wife has only recently become proud to be an American. His racist mentor/spiritual leader, Jeremiah Wright has for YEARS been preaching hatred of America and white people. His friend and co-worker, Bill Ayers has been backing him and nuturing him and working with him in the Illinois state political machine. His list of friends and acquaintances seems replete with racists and radicals.
 
 Kudos to Sarah Palin for attacking like a pit bull. Hopefully, she's not done yet.

S.C. chairwoman Carol Fowler today stated that Sarah Palin's only qualification for the vice presidency seems to be that she didn't have an abortion. 
 
 Very classy! And these people want to lead the country?

It's a predominantly black, poor inner city area with a depressed economy. You notice how I said it is, rather than was? Because Obama had no long term positive effect on it at all.
 
 Also, if you want to be rational and realistic. Blacks make up around 12% of the American population, and no one will deny that Obama was a community activist in the black community. But a full 88% of the rest of America is either white, hispanic, or other races etc... 
 
 So how can you say that by Sarah Palin governing a State with a population that reflects the National racial statistics, has less real world experience that Obama? Beside that, He never actually governed over anyone. He was a community worker at the street level. Nothing about that experience prepares a man for running the Mayors office even, much less a Governors office, and definitely not the Presidents office. 
 
 So stop kidding yourself and understand why the powers that be in the Democratic party are now going apoplectic because they understand all too well that they have backed a true empty suit, and that Hillary would have been a better candidate, even with the extremely HEAVY baggage that would have followed her around like an anchor around her neck.

 Dismissing Obama's efforts in Chicago is an insult to people who live in these types of communities. People like me.
